quotes.text: Don't worry about what anybody else is going to do. The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: Premature optimization is the root of all evil (or at least most of it) in programming.
quotes.author: Donald Knuth

quotes.text: Lisp has jokingly been called "the most intelligent way to misuse a computer". I think that description is a great compliment because it transmits the full flavor of liberation: it has assisted a number of our most gifted fellow humans in thinking previously impossible thoughts.
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.text: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: What Paul does, and does very well, is to take ideas and concepts that are beautiful in the abstract, and brings them down to a real world level. That's a rare talent to find in writing these days.
quotes.author: Jeff Bates

quotes.text: No problem should ever have to be solved twice.
quotes.author: Eric S. Raymond

quotes.text: Attitude is no substitute for competence.
quotes.author: Eric S. Raymond

quotes.text: It is said that the real winner is the one who lives in today but able to see tomorrow.
quotes.author: Juan Meng

quotes.text: Fools ignore complexity. Pragmatists suffer it. Some can avoid it. Geniuses remove it.
quotes.author: Alan J. Perlis

quotes.text: A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.
quotes.author: Alan J. Perlis

quotes.text: Dealing with failure is easy: Work hard to improve. Success is also easy to handle: You've solved the wrong problem. Work hard to improve.
quotes.author: Alan J. Perlis

quotes.text: Within a computer natural language is unnatural.
quotes.author: Alan J. Perlis

quotes.text: You think you know when you learn, are more sure when you can write, even more when you can teach, but certain when you can program.
quotes.author: Alan J. Perlis
